引: This kanji looks like a bow being stretched and primarily means "to pull." You will often use it to write the verb <ruby>引<rt>ひ</rt></ruby>く (to pull) or in the word for subtraction, <ruby>引<rt>ひ</rt></ruby>き<ruby>算<rt>ざん</rt></ruby>.
羽: This character represents feathers or wings and is often used for counting birds. You will see it in the word <ruby>羽<rt>はね</rt></ruby> (feather) and when counting birds using <ruby>羽<rt>わ</rt></ruby>.
雲: This kanji depicts rain hanging over a cloud and means "cloud." You will usually read it as <ruby>雲<rt>くも</rt></ruby> when describing the sky.
園: This character shows a planned space enclosed by a border and is used for gardens or parks. It is very common in words like <ruby>公<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>園<rt>えん</rt></ruby> (park) and <ruby>動<rt>どう</rt></ruby><ruby>物<rt>ぶつ</rt></ruby><ruby>園<rt>えん</rt></ruby> (zoo).
遠: This kanji means "far" or "distant." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>遠<rt>とお</rt></ruby>い (far) and in the word <ruby>遠<rt>えん</rt></ruby><ruby>足<rt>そく</rt></ruby> (excursion).
何: This is the essential kanji for asking questions like "what" or "how many." You will use it constantly in words like <ruby>何<rt>なに</rt></ruby> (what) and <ruby>何<rt>なん</rt></ruby><ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby> (what time).
科: This kanji is used to denote a department, course, or section. You will often see it in school subjects like <ruby>理<rt>り</rt></ruby><ruby>科<rt>か</rt></ruby> (science) and <ruby>教<rt>きょう</rt></ruby><ruby>科<rt>か</rt></ruby><ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby> (textbook).
夏: This character represents the season of "summer." You will use it to write <ruby>夏<rt>なつ</rt></ruby> (summer) and <ruby>夏<rt>なつ</rt></ruby><ruby>休<rt>やす</rt></ruby>み (summer vacation).
家: This kanji means "house" or "home" and includes the roof radical. It is read as <ruby>家<rt>いえ</rt></ruby> when talking about a house, and used in <ruby>家<rt>か</rt></ruby><ruby>族<rt>ぞく</rt></ruby> (family).
歌: This character represents a "song" or the act of singing. You will use it for the noun <ruby>歌<rt>うた</rt></ruby> (song) and the verb <ruby>歌<rt>うた</rt></ruby>う (to sing).
画: This kanji is used for pictures and strokes of a brush. It appears in <ruby>画<rt>が</rt></ruby><ruby>用<rt>よう</rt></ruby><ruby>紙<rt>し</rt></ruby> (drawing paper) and <ruby>計<rt>けい</rt></ruby><ruby>画<rt>かく</rt></ruby> (plan).
回: This kanji looks like something rotating and means "times" or "to turn." You use it to count occurrences like <ruby>一<rt>いっ</rt></ruby><ruby>回<rt>かい</rt></ruby> (one time) and in the verb <ruby>回<rt>まわ</rt></ruby>る (to turn).
会: This character means "to meet" or "association." You will write <ruby>会<rt>あ</rt></ruby>う (to meet) and use it in words like <ruby>会<rt>かい</rt></ruby><ruby>社<rt>しゃ</rt></ruby> (company).
海: This kanji has the water radical and means "sea" or "ocean." You will read it as <ruby>海<rt>うみ</rt></ruby> when talking about the ocean, and <ruby>かい</rt> in words like <ruby>海<rt>かい</rt></ruby><ruby>外<rt>がい</rt></ruby> (overseas).
絵: This kanji relates to drawings and pictures. It is most commonly used to write the word <ruby>絵<rt>え</rt></ruby> (picture) and <ruby>絵<rt>え</rt></ruby><ruby>本<rt>ほん</rt></ruby> (picture book).
外: This character means "outside" or "external." You will use it in <ruby>外<rt>そと</rt></ruby> (outside) and <ruby>外<rt>がい</rt></ruby><ruby>国<rt>こく</rt></ruby> (foreign country).
角: This kanji means "angle," "corner," or "horn." You will see it used as <ruby>三<rt>さん</rt></ruby><ruby>角<rt>かく</rt></ruby> (triangle) or <ruby>角<rt>かど</rt></ruby> (corner).
楽: This kanji means "fun" or "comfort," and is also used for music. You will use it in <ruby>楽<rt>たの</rt></ruby>しい (fun) and <ruby>音<rt>おん</rt></ruby><ruby>楽<rt>がく</rt></ruby> (music).
活: This character relates to life, activity, and energy. It is very common in the word <ruby>生<rt>せい</rt></ruby><ruby>活<rt>かつ</rt></ruby> (daily life/living).
間: This kanji represents a space or interval, depicted by the sun shining through a gate. You will use it in <ruby>間<rt>あいだ</rt></ruby> (between) and <ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>間<rt>かん</rt></ruby> (time).
丸: This simple kanji means "round" or "circle." You will use it to write <ruby>丸<rt>まる</rt></ruby> (circle) and <ruby>丸<rt>まる</rt></ruby>い (round).
岩: This character depicts a rock underneath a mountain cliff. You will read it as <ruby>岩<rt>いわ</rt></ruby> (rock/boulder).
顔: This kanji means "face." You will use it to write the word <ruby>顔<rt>かお</rt></ruby> (face) and <ruby>洗<rt>せん</rt></ruby><ruby>顔<rt>がん</rt></ruby> (washing one's face).
汽: This kanji represents steam or vapor. It is mostly found in the word <ruby>汽<rt>き</rt></ruby><ruby>車<rt>しゃ</rt></ruby> (steam train).
記: This character means to scribble or record. You will use it in words like <ruby>日<rt>にっ</rt></ruby><ruby>記<rt>き</rt></ruby> (diary) and <ruby>記<rt>き</rt></ruby><ruby>事<rt>じ</rt></ruby> (article).
帰: This kanji means "to return" home. You will commonly use it to write the verb <ruby>帰<rt>かえ</rt></ruby>る (to go home).
弓: This character is a pictogram of a bow used for shooting arrows. It is read as <ruby>弓<rt>ゆみ</rt></ruby> (bow).
牛: This kanji looks like the head of a cow and means "cow" or "cattle." You will read it as <ruby>牛<rt>うし</rt></ruby> (cow) or in words like <ruby>牛<rt>ぎゅう</rt></ruby><ruby>乳<rt>にゅう</rt></ruby> (milk).
魚: This kanji looks like a fish and means "fish." You will read it as <ruby>魚<rt>さかな</rt></ruby> (fish) or <ruby>金<rt>きん</rt></ruby><ruby>魚<rt>ぎょ</rt></ruby> (goldfish).
京: This character means "capital." You will see it in the names of cities like <ruby>東<rt>とう</rt></ruby><ruby>京<rt>きょう</rt></ruby> (Tokyo) and <ruby>京<rt>きょう</rt></ruby><ruby>都<rt>と</rt></ruby> (Kyoto).
強: This kanji means "strong." You will use it to write <ruby>強<rt>つよ</rt></ruby>い (strong) and <ruby>勉<rt>べん</rt></ruby><ruby>強<rt>きょう</rt></ruby> (study).
教: This character means "to teach" or "faith." You will use it for the verb <ruby>教<rt>おし</rt></ruby>える (to teach) and in <ruby>教<rt>きょう</rt></ruby><ruby>室<rt>しつ</rt></ruby> (classroom).
近: This kanji means "near" or "close." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>近<rt>ちか</rt></ruby>い (near) and in words like <ruby>近<rt>きん</rt></ruby><ruby>所<rt>じょ</rt></ruby> (neighborhood).
兄: This character represents an older brother. You will read it as <ruby>兄<rt>あに</rt></ruby> (my older brother) or <ruby>お<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>兄<rt>にい</rt></ruby>さん (someone else's older brother).
形: This kanji means "shape" or "form." You will use it in the word <ruby>形<rt>かたち</rt></ruby> (shape) and <ruby>図<rt>ず</rt></ruby><ruby>形<rt>けい</rt></ruby> (figure/diagram).
計: This character is used for measuring or planning. You will see it in <ruby>時<rt>と</rt></ruby><ruby>計<rt>けい</rt></ruby> (clock/watch) and <ruby>計<rt>けい</rt></ruby><ruby>画<rt>かく</rt></ruby> (plan).
元: This kanji means "origin" or "foundation." You will use it frequently in the greeting <ruby>元<rt>げん</rt></ruby><ruby>気<rt>き</rt></ruby> (healthy/energetic).
言: This character means "to say" or "word." You will write it as the verb <ruby>言<rt>い</rt></ruby>う (to say) and in <ruby>言<rt>こと</rt></ruby><ruby>葉<rt>ば</rt></ruby> (word/language).
原: This kanji means "field" or "meadow," or sometimes "original." You will see it in <ruby>原<rt>はら</rt></ruby><ruby>っぱ<rt></rt></ruby> (open field) and geographical names.
戸: This character represents a door, specifically a Japanese-style door. It is read as <ruby>戸<rt>と</rt></ruby> (door) or in words like <ruby>雨<rt>あま</rt></ruby><ruby>戸<rt>ど</rt></ruby> (storm shutter).
古: This kanji means "old" (for things, not people). You will use it to write <ruby>古<rt>ふる</rt></ruby>い (old) and in history-related words like <ruby>古<rt>こ</rt></ruby><ruby>代<rt>だい</rt></ruby> (ancient times).
午: This character is used for the sign of the horse, but mostly for "noon." You will see it everyday in <ruby>午<rt>ご</rt></ruby><ruby>前<rt>ぜん</rt></ruby> (A.M.) and <ruby>午<rt>ご</rt></ruby><ruby>後<rt>ご</rt></ruby> (P.M.).
後: This kanji means "behind," "after," or "later." You will use it in <ruby>後<rt>うし</rt></ruby>ろ (behind), <ruby>後<rt>あと</rt></ruby> (later), and <ruby>午<rt>ご</rt></ruby><ruby>後<rt>ご</rt></ruby> (P.M.).
語: This character means "language" or "to narrate." You will see it in <ruby>日<rt>に</rt></ruby><ruby>本<rt>ほん</rt></ruby><ruby>語<rt>ご</rt></ruby> (Japanese language) and <ruby>物<rt>もの</rt></ruby><ruby>語<rt>がたり</rt></ruby> (story).
工: This kanji means "craft" or "construction." You will see it in words like <ruby>工<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>作<rt>さく</rt></ruby> (handicrafts) and <ruby>工<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>場<rt>じょう</rt></ruby> (factory).
公: This character means "public." You will see it most often in <ruby>公<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>園<rt>えん</rt></ruby> (park) and <ruby>公<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>共<rt>きょう</rt></ruby> (public).
広: This kanji means "wide" or "spacious." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>広<rt>ひろ</rt></ruby>い (wide) and <ruby>広<rt>ひろ</rt></ruby><ruby>場<rt>ば</rt></ruby> (plaza).
交: This character means "mix" or "intersect." It is very common in the word <ruby>交<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>番<rt>ばん</rt></ruby> (police box) and <ruby>交<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>通<rt>つう</rt></ruby> (traffic).
光: This kanji means "light." You will use it for the noun <ruby>光<rt>ひかり</rt></ruby> (light) and the verb <ruby>光<rt>ひか</rt></ruby>る (to shine).
考: This character means "to think" or "consider." You will primarily use it as the verb <ruby>考<rt>かんが</rt></ruby>える (to think).
行: This kanji means "to go." It is one of the most common verbs, written as <ruby>行<rt>い</rt></ruby>く (to go), and also appears in <ruby>旅<rt>りょ</rt></ruby><ruby>行<rt>こう</rt></ruby> (travel).
高: This character means "tall" or "high" (and also expensive). You will use it in <ruby>高<rt>たか</rt></ruby>い (high/expensive) and <ruby>高<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>校<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>生<rt>せい</rt></ruby> (high school student).
黄: This kanji means "yellow." You will use it to write the color <ruby>黄<rt>き</rt></ruby><ruby>色<rt>いろ</rt></ruby> (yellow).
合: This character means "to fit," "join," or "meet." You will use it in <ruby>合<rt>あ</rt></ruby>う (to fit/match) and words like <ruby>場<rt>ば</rt></ruby><ruby>合<rt>あい</rt></ruby> (situation/case).
谷: This kanji represents a "valley." You will read it as <ruby>谷<rt>たに</rt></ruby> (valley).
国: This character means "country" and has the jewel radical inside a box. You will read it as <ruby>国<rt>くに</rt></ruby> (country) or in <ruby>外<rt>がい</rt></ruby><ruby>国<rt>こく</rt></ruby> (foreign country).
黒: This kanji means "black." You will use it to write <ruby>黒<rt>くろ</rt></ruby> (black) and the adjective <ruby>黒<rt>くろ</rt></ruby>い (black).
今: This character means "now." You will see it constantly in words like <ruby>今<rt>いま</rt></ruby> (now) and <ruby>今<rt>きょ</rt></ruby><ruby>日<rt>う</rt></ruby> (today).
才: This kanji is used for counting age (years old). You will use it when writing your age, for example, <ruby>七<rt>なな</rt></ruby><ruby>才<rt>さい</rt></ruby> (7 years old).
細: This character means "thin" or "slender." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>細<rt>ほそ</rt></ruby>い (thin) and <ruby>細<rt>こま</rt></ruby>かい (detailed/small).
作: This kanji means "to make." You will use it for the verb <ruby>作<rt>つく</rt></ruby>る (to make) and in words like <ruby>作<rt>さく</rt></ruby><ruby>文<rt>ぶん</rt></ruby> (essay/composition).
算: This character is related to calculation and math. You will see it in <ruby>算<rt>さん</rt></ruby><ruby>数<rt>すう</rt></ruby> (arithmetic) and <ruby>計<rt>けい</rt></ruby><ruby>算<rt>さん</rt></ruby> (calculation).
止: This kanji means "to stop." You will use it for the verb <ruby>止<rt>と</rt></ruby>まる (to stop) and on stop signs designated as <ruby>止<rt>と</rt></ruby>まれ.
市: This character means "city" or "market." You will see it in city names, like <ruby>市<rt>し</rt></ruby><ruby>長<rt>ちょう</rt></ruby> (mayor) or just <ruby>市<rt>いち</rt></ruby><ruby>場<rt>ば</rt></ruby> (market).
矢: This kanji depicts an "arrow." You will read it simply as <ruby>矢<rt>や</rt></ruby> (arrow).
姉: This character represents an older sister. You will read it as <ruby>姉<rt>あね</rt></ruby> (my older sister) or <ruby>お<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>姉<rt>ねえ</rt></ruby>さん (someone else's older sister).
思: This kanji means "to think" or "feel" (emotionally). You will commonly use it as the verb <ruby>思<rt>おも</rt></ruby>う (to think).
紙: This character means "paper." You will read it as <ruby>紙<rt>かみ</rt></ruby> (paper) or in words like <ruby>手<rt>て</rt></ruby><ruby>紙<rt>がみ</rt></ruby> (letter).
寺: This kanji represents a Buddhist "temple." You will read it as <ruby>寺<rt>てら</rt></ruby> (temple) or in temple names.
自: This character means "self." You will see it in very common words like <ruby>自<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>分<rt>ぶん</rt></ruby> (myself) and <ruby>自<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>由<rt>ゆう</rt></ruby> (freedom).
時: This kanji means "time" or "hour." You will use it in <ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>間<rt>かん</rt></ruby> (time) and to tell time, like <ruby>一<rt>いち</rt></ruby><ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby> (1 o'clock).
室: This character means "room." You will see it often in school in words like <ruby>教<rt>きょう</rt></ruby><ruby>室<rt>しつ</rt></ruby> (classroom) and <ruby>図<rt>と</rt></ruby><ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby><ruby>室<rt>しつ</rt></ruby> (library room).
社: This kanji means "company" or "shrine." You will use it in <ruby>会<rt>かい</rt></ruby><ruby>社<rt>しゃ</rt></ruby> (company) and <ruby>神<rt>じん</rt></ruby><ruby>社<rt>じゃ</rt></ruby> (shrine).
弱: This character means "weak." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>弱<rt>よわ</rt></ruby>い (weak).
首: This kanji means "neck." You will read it as <ruby>首<rt>くび</rt></ruby> (neck) and it is also used in <ruby>手<rt>て</rt></ruby><ruby>首<rt>くび</rt></ruby> (wrist).
秋: This character represents the season of "autumn." You will use it to write <ruby>秋<rt>あき</rt></ruby> (autumn).
週: This kanji means "week." You will use it in <ruby>今<rt>こん</rt></ruby><ruby>週<rt>しゅう</rt></ruby> (this week) and <ruby>来<rt>らい</rt></ruby><ruby>週<rt>しゅう</rt></ruby> (next week).
春: This character represents the season of "spring." You will use it to write <ruby>春<rt>はる</rt></ruby> (spring).
書: This kanji means "to write." You will use it for the verb <ruby>書<rt>か</rt></ruby>く (to write) and in <ruby>読<rt>どく</rt></ruby><ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby> (reading).
少: This character means "few" or "little." You will use it in <ruby>少<rt>すく</rt></ruby>ない (few/scarce) and <ruby>少<rt>すこ</rt></ruby>し (a little).
場: This kanji means "place." You will see it in <ruby>場<rt>ば</rt></ruby><ruby>所<rt>しょ</rt></ruby> (place) and <ruby>広<rt>ひろ</rt></ruby><ruby>場<rt>ば</rt></ruby> (plaza/square).
色: This character means "color." You will read it as <ruby>色<rt>いろ</rt></ruby> (color) and use it to ask <ruby>何<rt>なに</rt></ruby><ruby>色<rt>いろ</rt></ruby> (what color?).
食: This kanji means "to eat" or "food." You will use it for the verb <ruby>食<rt>た</rt></ruby>べる (to eat) and in <ruby>食<rt>た</rt></ruby>べ<ruby>物<rt>もの</rt></ruby> (food).
心: This character means "heart" or "mind." You will read it as <ruby>心<rt>こころ</rt></ruby> (heart) and see it in <ruby>安<rt>あん</rt></ruby><ruby>心<rt>しん</rt></ruby> (relief).
新: This kanji means "new." You will use it to write <ruby>新<rt>あたら</rt></ruby>しい (new) and in <ruby>新<rt>しん</rt></ruby><ruby>聞<rt>ぶん</rt></ruby> (newspaper).
親: This character means "parent" or "intimate." You will use it in <ruby>親<rt>おや</rt></ruby> (parent) and <ruby>親<rt>しん</rt></ruby><ruby>切<rt>せつ</rt></ruby> (kind).
図: This kanji means "drawing," "plan," or "map." You will see it in <ruby>地<rt>ち</rt></ruby><ruby>図<rt>ず</rt></ruby> (map) and <ruby>図<rt>と</rt></ruby><ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby><ruby>館<rt>かん</rt></ruby> (library).
数: This character means "number" or "to count." You will use it for the verb <ruby>数<rt>かぞ</rt></ruby>える (to count) and in <ruby>算<rt>さん</rt></ruby><ruby>数<rt>すう</rt></ruby> (arithmetic).
西: This kanji means "west." You will read it as <ruby>西<rt>にし</rt></ruby> (west).
声: This character means "voice." You will read it as <ruby>声<rt>こえ</rt></ruby> (voice) and use it when talking about <ruby>大<rt>おお</rt></ruby>きな<ruby>声<rt>こえ</rt></ruby> (loud voice).
星: This kanji means "star." You will read it as <ruby>星<rt>ほし</rt></ruby> (star).
晴: This character means "sunny" or "clear weather." You will use it to write <ruby>晴<rt>は</rt></ruby>れ (sunny weather).
切: This kanji means "to cut." You will use it for the verb <ruby>切<rt>き</rt></ruby>る (to cut) and in <ruby>大<rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby>切<rt>せつ</rt></ruby> (important).
雪: This character means "snow." You will read it as <ruby>雪<rt>ゆき</rt></ruby> (snow).
船: This kanji means "ship" or "boat." You will read it as <ruby>船<rt>ふね</rt></ruby> (ship).
線: This character means "line." You will see it in words like <ruby>線<rt>せん</rt></ruby><ruby>路<rt>ろ</rt></ruby> (railway track) or <ruby>新<rt>しん</rt></ruby><ruby>幹<rt>かん</rt></ruby><ruby>線<rt>せん</rt></ruby> (bullet train).
前: This kanji means "before" or "front." You will use it in <ruby>前<rt>まえ</rt></ruby> (front/before) and <ruby>午<rt>ご</rt></ruby><ruby>前<rt>ぜん</rt></ruby> (A.M.).
組: This character means "group" or "class" (school class). You will use it in words like <ruby>組<rt>くみ</rt></ruby> (class/team) and <ruby>番<rt>ばん</rt></ruby><ruby>組<rt>ぐみ</rt></ruby> (TV program).
走: This kanji means "to run." You will commonly use it for the verb <ruby>走<rt>はし</rt></ruby>る (to run).
多: This character means "many" or "much." You will use it to write the adjective <ruby>多<rt>おお</rt></ruby>い (many).
太: This kanji means "fat" or "thick." You will use it for the adjective <ruby>太<rt>ふと</rt></ruby>い (thick/fat) and in <ruby>太<rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby>陽<rt>よう</rt></ruby> (sun).
体: This character means "body." You will read it as <ruby>体<rt>からだ</rt></ruby> (body) or in <ruby>体<rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby>育<rt>いく</rt></ruby> (P.E. class).
台: This kanji is used for stands, platforms, or counting machines. You will see it in <ruby>台<rt>だい</rt></ruby><ruby>所<rt>どころ</rt></ruby> (kitchen) and <ruby>台<rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby>風<rt>ふう</rt></ruby> (typhoon).
地: This character means "ground" or "earth." You will see it in <ruby>地<rt>ち</rt></ruby><ruby>図<rt>ず</rt></ruby> (map) and <ruby>地<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>面<rt>めん</rt></ruby> (ground).
池: This kanji means "pond." You will read it as <ruby>池<rt>いけ</rt></ruby> (pond) and see it in <ruby>電<rt>でん</rt></ruby><ruby>池<rt>ち</rt></ruby> (battery).
知: This character means "to know." You will use it for the verb <ruby>知<rt>し</rt></ruby>る (to know).
茶: This kanji means "tea." You will see it in <ruby>お<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>茶<rt>ちゃ</rt></ruby> (green tea) and <ruby>茶<rt>ちゃ</rt></ruby><ruby>色<rt>いろ</rt></ruby> (brown).
昼: This character means "noon" or "daytime." You will use it in <ruby>昼<rt>ひる</rt></ruby> (noon) and <ruby>昼<rt>ひる</rt></ruby><ruby>ご<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>飯<rt>はん</rt></ruby> (lunch).
長: This kanji means "long" or "leader." You will use it for the adjective <ruby>長<rt>なが</rt></ruby>い (long) and in <ruby>校<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>長<rt>ちょう</rt></ruby><ruby>先<rt>せん</rt></ruby><ruby>生<rt>せい</rt></ruby> (principal).
鳥: This character means "bird." You will read it as <ruby>鳥<rt>とり</rt></ruby> (bird) and see it in <ruby>小<rt>こ</rt></ruby><ruby>鳥<rt>とり</rt></ruby> (small bird).
朝: This kanji means "morning." You will use it to write <ruby>朝<rt>あさ</rt></ruby> (morning) and <ruby>朝<rt>あさ</rt></ruby><ruby>ご<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>飯<rt>はん</rt></ruby> (breakfast).
直: This character means "straight" or "fix." You will use it in verbs like <ruby>直<rt>なお</rt></ruby>す (to fix) and words like <ruby>直<rt>ちょく</rt></ruby><ruby>線<rt>せん</rt></ruby> (straight line).
通: This kanji means "to pass through" or "commute." You will use it in <ruby>通<rt>かよ</rt></ruby>う (to commute) and <ruby>通<rt>とお</rt></ruby>る (to pass through).
弟: This character represents a younger brother. You will read it as <ruby>弟<rt>おとうと</rt></ruby> (younger brother).
店: This kanji means "shop" or "store." You will read it as <ruby>店<rt>みせ</rt></ruby> (shop) and see it in words like <ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby><ruby>店<rt>てん</rt></ruby> (bookstore).
点: This character means "point" or "score." You will see it in <ruby>点<rt>てん</rt></ruby><ruby>数<rt>すう</rt></ruby> (points/score) and <ruby>交<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>さ<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>点<rt>てん</rt></ruby> (intersection).
電: This kanji means "electricity." You will use it constantly in words like <ruby>電<rt>でん</rt></ruby><ruby>車<rt>しゃ</rt></ruby> (train) and <ruby>電<rt>でん</rt></ruby><ruby>話<rt>わ</rt></ruby> (telephone).
刀: This character represents a "sword" or "knife." You will read it as <ruby>刀<rt>かたな</rt></ruby> (sword).
冬: This kanji represents the season of "winter." You will use it to write <ruby>冬<rt>ふゆ</rt></ruby> (winter) and <ruby>冬<rt>ふゆ</rt></ruby><ruby>休<rt>やす</rt></ruby>み (winter vacation).
当: This character means "hit" or "appropriate." You will see it in <ruby>本<rt>ほん</rt></ruby><ruby>当<rt>とう</rt></ruby> (really/truth) and the verb <ruby>当<rt>あ</rt></ruby>たる (to hit/win).
東: This kanji means "east." You will read it as <ruby>東<rt>ひがし</rt></ruby> (east) and see it in <ruby>東<rt>とう</rt></ruby><ruby>京<rt>きょう</rt></ruby> (Tokyo).
答: This character means "answer." You will use it for the noun <ruby>答<rt>こた</rt></ruby>え (answer) and the verb <ruby>答<rt>こた</rt></ruby>える (to answer).
頭: This kanji means "head." You will read it as <ruby>頭<rt>あたま</rt></ruby> (head).
同: This character means "same." You will use it in <ruby>同<rt>おな</rt></ruby>じ (same) and <ruby>同<rt>どう</rt></ruby><ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby> (same time).
道: This kanji means "road" or "way." You will read it as <ruby>道<rt>みち</rt></ruby> (road) and see it in <ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby><ruby>道<rt>どう</rt></ruby> (calligraphy).
読: This character means "to read." You will use it for the verb <ruby>読<rt>よ</rt></ruby>む (to read) and in <ruby>読<rt>どく</rt></ruby><ruby>書<rt>しょ</rt></ruby> (reading).
内: This kanji means "inside." You will see it in <ruby>家<rt>か</rt></ruby><ruby>内<rt>ない</rt></ruby> (wife/inside the house) and <ruby>案<rt>あん</rt></ruby><ruby>内<rt>ない</rt></ruby> (guide).
南: This character means "south." You will read it as <ruby>南<rt>みなみ</rt></ruby> (south).
肉: This kanji means "meat." You will read it as <ruby>肉<rt>にく</rt></ruby> (meat) in words like <ruby>牛<rt>ぎゅう</rt></ruby><ruby>肉<rt>にく</rt></ruby> (beef).
馬: This character means "horse." You will read it as <ruby>馬<rt>うま</rt></ruby> (horse).
売: This kanji means "to sell." You will use it for the verb <ruby>売<rt>う</rt></ruby>る (to sell) and in <ruby>売<rt>ばい</rt></ruby><ruby>店<rt>てん</rt></ruby> (shop/kiosk).
買: This character means "to buy." You will use it for the verb <ruby>買<rt>か</rt></ruby>う (to buy) and in <ruby>買<rt>か</rt></ruby>い<ruby>物<rt>もの</rt></ruby> (shopping).
麦: This kanji means "wheat" or "barley." You will see it in <ruby>麦<rt>むぎ</rt></ruby><ruby>茶<rt>ちゃ</rt></ruby> (barley tea).
半: This character means "half." You will use it in <ruby>半<rt>はん</rt></ruby><ruby>分<rt>ぶん</rt></ruby> (half) and when telling time like <ruby>三<rt>さん</rt></ruby><ruby>時<rt>じ</rt></ruby><ruby>半<rt>はん</rt></ruby> (3:30).
番: This kanji means "turn" or "number." You will use it in <ruby>一<rt>いち</rt></ruby><ruby>番<rt>ばん</rt></ruby> (number one/best) and <ruby>交<rt>こう</rt></ruby><ruby>番<rt>ばん</rt></ruby> (police box).
父: This character means "father." You will read it as <ruby>父<rt>ちち</rt></ruby> (my father) or <ruby>お<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>父<rt>とう</rt></ruby>さん (someone else's father).
風: This kanji means "wind." You will read it as <ruby>風<rt>かぜ</rt></ruby> (wind) and see it in <ruby>台<rt>たい</rt></ruby><ruby>風<rt>ふう</rt></ruby> (typhoon).
分: This character means "part," "minute," or "to divide." You will use it in <ruby>分<rt>わ</rt></ruby>かる (to understand) and for minutes like <ruby>五<rt>ご</rt></ruby><ruby>分<rt>ふん</rt></ruby> (5 minutes).
聞: This kanji means "to listen" or "ask." You will use it for the verb <ruby>聞<rt>き</rt></ruby>く (to listen/ask) and in <ruby>新<rt>しん</rt></ruby><ruby>聞<rt>ぶん</rt></ruby> (newspaper).
米: This character means "rice" (uncooked). You will read it as <ruby>米<rt>こめ</rt></ruby> (rice).
歩: This kanji means "to walk." You will use it for the verb <ruby>歩<rt>ある</rt></ruby>く (to walk) and in <ruby>散<rt>さん</rt></ruby><ruby>歩<rt>ぽ</rt></ruby> (stroll).
母: This character means "mother." You will read it as <ruby>母<rt>はは</rt></ruby> (my mother) or <ruby>お<rt></rt></ruby><ruby>母<rt>かあ</rt></ruby>さん (someone else's mother).
方: This kanji means "direction" or "person" (polite). You will see it in <ruby>方<rt>ほう</rt></ruby><ruby>法<rt>ほう</rt></ruby> (method) and <ruby>読<rt>よ</rt></ruby>み<ruby>方<rt>かた</rt></ruby> (way of reading).
北: This character means "north." You will read it as <ruby>北<rt>きた</rt></ruby> (north) and see it in <ruby>北<rt>ほっ</rt></ruby><ruby>海<rt>かい</rt></ruby><ruby>道<rt>どう</rt></ruby> (Hokkaido).
毎: This kanji means "every." You will use it in common words like <ruby>毎<rt>まい</rt></ruby><ruby>日<rt>にち</rt></ruby> (every day) and <ruby>毎<rt>まい</rt></ruby><ruby>週<rt>しゅう</rt></ruby> (every week).
妹: This character represents a younger sister. You will read it as <ruby>妹<rt>いもうと</rt></ruby> (younger sister).
万: This kanji means "ten thousand." You will use it for counting large numbers, like <ruby>一<rt>いち</rt></ruby><ruby>万<rt>まん</rt></ruby> (10,000).
明: This character means "bright." You will use it in <ruby>明<rt>あか</rt></ruby>るい (bright) and <ruby>明<rt>あした</rt></ruby> (tomorrow).
鳴: This kanji means "chirp" or "cry" (of animals). You will use it for the verb <ruby>鳴<rt>な</rt></ruby>く (to chirp/cry).
毛: This character means "hair" or "fur." You will read it as <ruby>毛<rt>け</rt></ruby> (hair/fur).
門: This kanji looks like swinging doors and means "gate." You will read it as <ruby>門<rt>もん</rt></ruby> (gate) or in <ruby>正<rt>せい</rt></ruby><ruby>門<rt>もん</rt></ruby> (main gate).
夜: This character means "night." You will read it as <ruby>夜<rt>よる</rt></ruby> (night) and see it in <ruby>今<rt>こん</rt></ruby><ruby>夜<rt>や</rt></ruby> (tonight).
野: This kanji means "field" or "plain." You will see it in <ruby>野<rt>や</rt></ruby><ruby>球<rt>きゅう</rt></ruby> (baseball) and <ruby>野<rt>や</rt></ruby><ruby>菜<rt>さい</rt></ruby> (vegetables).
友: This character means "friend." You will use it in the word <ruby>友<rt>とも</rt></ruby><ruby>達<rt>だち</rt></ruby> (friend).
用: This kanji means "business" or "use." You will see it in <ruby>用<rt>よう</rt></ruby><ruby>事<rt>じ</rt></ruby> (errand/business) and <ruby>利<rt>り</rt></ruby><ruby>用<rt>よう</rt></ruby> (use).
曜: This character is used for days of the week. You will see it in <ruby>月<rt>げつ</rt></ruby><ruby>曜<rt>よう</rt></ruby><ruby>日<rt>び</rt></ruby> (Monday), <ruby>日<rt>にち</rt></ruby><ruby>曜<rt>よう</rt></ruby><ruby>日<rt>び</rt></ruby> (Sunday), etc.
来: This kanji means "to come." You will use it for the verb <ruby>来<rt>く</rt></ruby>る (to come) and in <ruby>来<rt>らい</rt></ruby><ruby>週<rt>しゅう</rt></ruby> (next week).
里: This character is an old unit of distance or means "village." You will see it in <ruby>里<rt>さと</rt></ruby> (village).
理: This kanji means "reason" or "logic." You will see it in school subjects like <ruby>理<rt>り</rt></ruby><ruby>科<rt>か</rt></ruby> (science) and words like <ruby>理<rt>り</rt></ruby><ruby>由<rt>ゆう</rt></ruby> (reason).
話: This character means "to speak" or "story." You will use it for the verb <ruby>話<rt>はな</rt></ruby>す (to speak) and the noun <ruby>話<rt>はなし</rt></ruby> (story).
